content: by midknight designs quick and easy sponge scrubby jennifer l christensen midknightstarr webs com midknightstarr@gmail com materials  1 ball lion brand kitchen cotton*  6 wide tulle* i used the joann craft essentials tulle spool from joann fabrics and crafts  6 wide in a 20 yard spool  9 mm crochet hook  tapestry needle *note i do not recommend using netting netting is too stiff and more abrasive than tulle this pattern uses 2 of strands of yarn held together but only 1 ball is needed so use both ends the inside and outside of the cotton instructions holding 2 strands of the cotton together chain 17 row 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook single_crochet in every chain to the end 16 single_crochet row 2 & 3 chain 1 turn hold tulle on top of row 1 working around the tulle single_crochet in each stitch to end of row 16 single_crochet pick up the tulle row 4 chain 1 with the tulle only and working over the 2 strands of cotton single_crochet in each stitch to end of row 16 single_crochet pick up the cotton row 5 & 6 chain 1 with the cotton and working over the tulle single_crochet in each stitch to end of row 16sc cut the tulle row 7 chain 1 single_crochet in each stitch to end finish off edging fold piece in half matching up stitches 8 single_crochet on top of each side working through both sides join tulle in stitches nearest to fold placing tail of tulle inside fold single_crochet in same stitch as join and in each of next 6 stitches 3 single_crochet in corner stitch working along the side work 5 single_crochet 3 single_crochet in corner note i recommend stuffing all ends inside scrubby before finishing the last side single_crochet in next 7 stitches optional chain 9 and join in last single_crochet for hanging loop finish off midknightstarr webs com midknightstarr worpress com midknightstarr@gmail com copyright 2008-20014
